topic.title: Allocating Host Memory Using the CLI
topic.shortdesc: You can edit the platform and huge page memory allocations for a NUMA node from the CLI.

steps.li: Use the following command to set the memory allocations.

pd.p: is the hostname or id of the compute node
is the NUMA node of the compute node (0 or 1)
(if the optional -m argument is included) the amount of memory reserved for platform use, in MiB.
(if the optional -2M argument is included) the number of 2MiB huge pages to make available.
(if the optional -1G argument is included) number of 1GiB huge pages to make available

steps.p: For example, to allocate four 2 MiB huge pages for use by VMs on NUMA node 1 of compute node compute-0 :
steps.li: Wait for the host to be reported as available.
steps.codeblock: (keystone_admin)$ system host-list hostname +----+--------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+--------------+ | id | hostname | personality | administrative | operational | availability | +----+--------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+--------------+ | 1 | controller-0 | controller | unlocked | enabled | available | | 2 | controller-1 | controller | unlocked | enabled | available | | 3 | compute-0 | compute | unlocked | enabledd | available | +----+--------------+-------------+----------------+-------------+--------------+
